alert.note: Alert for Kimble (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 9:26PM CDT until June 16 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Kimble. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 923 PM CDT, radar indicated thunderstorms with very heavy rain regenerating over central Kimble County over the Junction area, from from west of Junction to Segovia. Rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches will cause street flooding in Junction, and flooding of low-lying areas and low water crossings in the area in and around Junction. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Junction, Segovia and South Llano River State Park. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 448 and 449...and between Mile Markers 452 and 472. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Park Road 73 crossing South Llano River, FM 2169 crossing Johnson Fork Creek, FM 2169 crossing Johnson Fork Creek, FM 2169 crossing Johnson Fork Creek, County Road 430 crossing Johnson Fork, County Road 430 crossing Joy Creek, Old Segovia Rd. crossing Johnson Fork, crossings along County Road 410 and Flatrock Ln. crossing South Llano River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding at night.
